org.gearvrf.io

Interface IWearTouchpadEvents

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IEvents

    public interface IWearTouchpadEvents
extends IEvents
    This interface describes IEvents generated from the touchpad of a connected Android Wear watch. To listen to these events add a listener to the GVRContext by calling GVRContext.getEventReceiver(). These events will only be generated if useAndroidWearTouchpad="true" is used in gvr.xml file. If connected to an Android Wear Watch all the MotionEvents generated by interacting with the touchpad of the watch are delivered to the GVRActivity. The touchpad of the watch can be used as a drop-in replacement for the touchpad on the side of the GearVR headset. it is required that the WearTouchPad app is installed on a phone which is paired to an Android wear watch.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onConnectionFailed()
      This event is generated if a connection could not be established to the WearTouchpad app on the Android wear watch.
      void onConnectionSuccessful()
      This event is generated when a connection to the Android Wear watch is successfully established
      void onTouchEvent(MotionEvent motionEvent)
      This is called every time there is a new MotionEvent from the Andoid wear app.

    • Method Detail

      • onTouchEvent

        void onTouchEvent(MotionEvent motionEvent)
        This is called every time there is a new MotionEvent from the Andoid wear app. MotionEvents are generated every time the user interracts with the touchpad on the Android wear app
        Parameters:
        motionEvent - motion event generated by touch.

      • onConnectionSuccessful

        void onConnectionSuccessful()
        This event is generated when a connection to the Android Wear watch is successfully established

      • onConnectionFailed

        void onConnectionFailed()
        This event is generated if a connection could not be established to the WearTouchpad app on the Android wear watch. This may be due to the following reasons: 1. WearTouchPad app is not installed on the phone, watch or both. 2. Phone is not connected to a watch.
